heading: e-music: how to pay the piper
subheading: will that be cash, check, or micropayment? digital music might be the road to e-commerce's dreams of charging for those under-a-dollar purchases. by jennifer sullivan.
author: jennifer sullivan
text: digital music could be the tonic that brings e-commerce micropayment schemes back from the dead. a series of partnerships with music sites are the latest vital signs. for years, online businesses have dreamed of the day when they could charge 5 cents for an old new yorker column, or 50 cents for a beatles tune. but smartcards and e-wallets that facilitate micropayments systems have failed to take off in the united states, mostly because there hasn't been much online content worth the price.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
